Package com.xceptance.testbddy.core.bdd.scenario

Class Scenario

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xceptance.testbddy.core.bdd.scenario.AbstractScenario
      • com.xceptance.testbddy.core.bdd.scenario.Scenario
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Statusable
    public class Scenario
extends AbstractScenario
    Represents a scenario in the BDD Hierarchy.
    To execute it, see the test() method.
    Author:
    ckeiner

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Scenario​(java.lang.String description)
      Creates a new, pending Scenario with a description.
      Scenario​(java.lang.String description, Steps steps)
      Creates a new Scenario with the specified description and steps.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Steps getSteps()  
      Scenario ignore()
      Ignore this component.
      This means, it doesn't appear in the report.
      Scenario skip()
      Skip this component.
      This means, it appears in the report, but is not executed.
      void skipScenario()
      Skips the scenario and reports it as such.
      void test()
      Executes the scenario.
      Every exception and error is re-thrown as ScenarioException and ScenarioError respectively.
      Scenario wip()
      This component is a work in progess.

      • Methods inherited from class com.xceptance.testbddy.core.bdd.scenario.AbstractScenario

        getDescription, getReporter, getStatus, setReporter

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
